title: Idea regarding small amounts of LP until reaching promotional games.
body:
I think maybe it might be worth exploring, and I understand it may fall under "Pay 2 Win" in some people's eyes (I don't think so, but I could see some feeling this way), but I don't think any of us like that feeling when you win a hard fought game and then see you are 99 LP, wouldn't it be a win/win situation if when you are at 95, or even 97 or more LP, you could spend 1 RP per point needed just to get into "promos".

I see this as helping in a number of ways...

1) Players won't feel semi-defeated after seeing they are so close to reaching promos.

2) This would help people with small amounts of RP left over after other transactions

3) This would add a feature that LoL doesn't currently have, "micro-transactions", this gives players the feeling of good "Bang for their buck" even if they don't spend a lot of money at a time, they could get a lot out of only a little RP in the long run, and as I said, helpful when you have less than 100 or so RP.

4) This would help deplete left over RP and unused RP and a "sink" of some sort to better help Riot make more money to continue to support themselves.

5) It would be completely optional, so you can choose to do it, or you can choose not to.

6) And finally, it really doesn't provide enough of a boon that it would be exploitable by people who would venture to do something like that.

Anyways, I'd love to hear some thoughts on this from anyone who would like to give them, thanks for your time.

replies.body:
If this was added, players would probably be madder than the whole Dyn Q fiasco. 

Pay2Win in a competitive game is really bad, like "Game being abandoned by tons of players" bad.

It's also kinda pointless since eventually you'd get that LP you "missed out on" by increasing your MMR from winning that extra game to get 100 LP. This would be really cater to low elo players and whales (players who spend a lot of money), and spitting in the face of high elo players and dedicated, but low-spending players. You'd see micro-transactions  like this in a mobile game, which aims to make as much money as possible without making their players too mad. Micro-transactions in any other genre is considered real taboo.

Seeing as this is almost literally a way to guarantee that you get into promos, and like you said it's almost a pay-2-win scenario, I don't see this getting added anytime soon.

You're welcome to post this over in general discussion to see what your community feels about the idea!
